Registration of Deaths (Temporary Provisions)  Act, No. 58 of 1998  (Certified on 15th December, 1998)  L.D.—0. 14/98,

ANACTT0 PROVIDE FOR THE REGISTRATION OF DEATHS OF PERSONS  REPORTED MISSING ; AND FOR MATTERS CONNECTED THEREWITH  OR INCIDENTAL THERETO  WHEREAS several persons have died in the course of the  civil disturbances that took place due to terrorist and  subversive activities in Sri Lanka; and whereas there are  certain practical difficulties impeding the registration of such  deaths under the provisions of the Births and Deaths
Registration Act (Chapter 110):
AND WHEREAS it has now become necessary to make  Provision enabling the registration of such deaths:
NOW THEREFORE be it enacted by the Parliament of the  Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka as follows :—

1. This Act may be cited as the Registration of Deaths — shorttile and  (Temporary Provisions) Act, No. 58 of 1998. The provisions duration of the  of this Act shall be in operation for a period of two years At  from the date of its commencement.

2. Where any person is reported missing and presumed — Who may apply  to be dead as he has not been heard of fora period exceeding for death  ‘one year by those who would naturally have heard of himhad _***tifcates.  he been alive, a next of kin of such person if he verily believes  such person to be dead, may, apply in the manner hereinafter  Provided, to register the death of such person under the Births  and Deaths Registration Act (Chapter 110) and to have issued  to him, a Certificate of Death in respect of such person.

3. Every application under this Act to register the death Procedure for  of a person shall be made either to the Registrar-General or pplication.  to the District Registrar of Births and Deaths of the district  in which such person was last residing, and shall be in the  form set out in the Schedule to this Act.

2 Registration of Deaths (Temporary Provisions)  Act, No. 58 of 1998  ‘Additional 4. Every application under this Act shali be supported  material tobe by an affidavit of the applicant setting out the grounds for his  ‘supplied. belief that the person whose death is sought to be registered,  is dead, ana sinall be accompanied by, a report from the Grama  Niladhari of the Grama Niladhari Division in which the person  whose death is sought to be registered, was last resident,  confirming the fact that such person has not been seen alive  or heard of, for a period of over one year, and any other  evidence in support of such application.  Display of 5. Upon receipt of an application under this Act, the  application Registrar-General or the District Registrar as the case may be  shall cause a copy of such application to be displayed for a  period of two weeks on the Notice Board kept at his office  and in the office of the Grama Niladhari in whose division  the person whose death is sought to be registered, was last  resident or had his permanent residence.  Objections to 6. Any person may within one month of the date on which  registration, a copy of an application under this Act is first displayed as  provided for in section 5, forward to the Registrar-General or  the District Registrar, as the case may be, his objections in  writing, to the registration of the death of the person to whom  such application relates, and such objections shall be supported  by an affidavit of the objector and of any other person, setting  out the grounds for their objections. :  Registration of 7. (1) On the expiry of the period of one month allowed  death, for the forwarding of objections to an application, the  Registrar-General or the District Registrar as the case may  be shall consider the application together with the evidence  - in support of the application and the objections, if any, and  the evidence in support of such objections, and after such  inquiry as he may deem necessary, if satisfied as to the uth  of the matters stated in the application, allow such application  and shall send to the Registrar-General a Certificate under  his hand setting out such of the particulars of the death as are  required to be registered, under the Births and Deaths  Registration Act (Chapter 110) as he has been able to ascertain  after such inquiry as aforesaid.  (2) On receipt of the certificate under subsection (1), the  Registrar-General shall, except in a case where he cancels @  certificate in the exercise of the powers conferred on him by  section 8, make order directing the appropriate Registrar to

Registration of Deaths (Temporary Provisions) 3  Act, No. 58 of 1998  ‘enter in the Register of Deaths maintained by such Registrar :  under the Birth and Deaths Registration Act (Chapter 110),  the particulars specified in such certificate.

(3) On receipt by a Registrar of an order under subsection  (2) directing him to enter the particulars relating to a death in  the Register of Deaths maintained by him, under the Births  and Deaths Registration Act (Chapter 1 10), the Registrar shall  forthwith enter those particulars in such register and sign the  register in the appropriate place.

(4) Every written order under subsection (2) shall be  attached to the duplicate of the relevant registration entry and  shall be sent together with that duplicate, by the Registrar to  the appropriate District Registrar for transmission to the  Registrar-General for custody in his office.

8. An applicant who is dissatisfied with the decision of Appeal against  the District Registrar refusing to issue a certificate to him refusal to isve  under section 7, or a person who has objected under section 6 Peres eae  to the issue of a certificate under this Act and who is cate.  dissatisfied with the decision of the District Registrar to issue  Such certificate, may within one month of the notification of  Such refusal or issue, as the case may be, appeal to the  Registrar-General against such refusal or issue, as the case  may be. The Registrar-General may after review of the  material before him, affirm the decision of the District  Registrar or direct the District Registrar to issue a certificate  under section 7 or cancel a certificate issued by that District  Registrar under section 7, as the case may be.

9. (1) Where a Commission appointed under the Special procedure  Commissions of Inquiry Act (Chapter 393) or a Special rating’o,  ~ Presidential Commission of Inquiry established under the {caine of persons

Special Presidential Commissions Law, No. 7 of 1978 finds in respect of  that a person has disappeared or is missing, the next of kin of whom there are  that person may apply, to the Registrar-General or to the findings bY  District Registrar of Births and Deaths ofthe district in which frauiy ora  that person was last residing, in he form setoutin the Schedule Special
to this Act, to register the death ofthat person under the Births Presidential  and Deaths Registration Act (Chapter 110) and tohaveissued [rin
to him, a Certificate of Death in respect of that person. Every
‘such application shall be accompanied by an affidavit of the
4 Registration of Deaths (Temporary Provisions)

Act, No. 58 of 1998  applicant in terms of section 4 and a certified copy of the  finding of the Commission of Inquiry or Special Presidential  Commission of Inquiry, as the case may be, relating to that  person.

(2) Upon receipt of an application under subsection (1),  the District Registrar shall, notwithstanding anything to  contrary in the preceding provisions of this Act, forthwith  send to the Registrar-General a certificate under his hand,  setting out the particulars of the death required to be registered  under the Births and Deaths Registration Act (Chapter 110)  as he has been able to ascertain from the application and the  accompanying affidavit and finding.

(3) Upon receipt of a certificate under subsection (2), the  Registrar-General shall make order directing the appropriate  Registrar to register in the Register of Deaths maintained by  such Registrar under the Births and Deaths Registration Act  (Chapter 110), the particulars specified in such certificate.

(4) Upon receipt of an order under subsection (3) directing  him to enter the particulars relating to a death in the Register  of Deaths maintained by him under the Births and Deaths  Registration Act (Chapter 110), the Registrar shall forthwith  enter such particulars in such register and sign the register in  the appropriate place.

(5) Every order made under subsection (3) shall be  attached to the duplicate of the relevant registration entry and  shall be sent together with the duplicate, by the Registrar, to  the appropriate District Registrar for transmission to the  Registrar-General for custody in his office.

(6) Where the application under subsection (1) is made to  the Registrar-General, the provisions of subsections (2) and  (9) shall mutatis mutandis apply as if the reference in those  section to the District Registrar is a reference to the Registrar-  General.
